page.title: 04Hill Of Mulderie _ Mulben
page.content: The Hill of Mulderie rises to 311 metres above sea level. It is elongated in shape and has gentle slopes. The upper slopes are covered in conifer plantation, planted by The Forestry Commission. The plantation covers an area of 248 hectares or 620 acres. Before the Forestry Commission started planting, the Hill of Mulderie was barren except for a few trees. The first trees were planted by Forestry workers in 1948. Ten years later in 1958, a further section of Mulderie was planted. More trees were planted in 1980. Before the trees were planted, some local people used to cut peat to provide fuel for their fires. Peat cutting was done on the low ground at the foot of Mulderie Hill. No peat is cut there now.
